dt: {bc}to react with a sudden brief involuntary movement
{bc}to come into being, activity, or operation
{bc}to become loosened or forced out of place
{bc}to range from a specified initial point
{bc}to be a participant in a game or contest
{bc}to cause to leave a place of concealment {bc}{sx|flush||}
{bc}to bring up for consideration or discussion
{bc}to cause to become loosened or displaced
{bc}to cause to move, act, or operate
{bc}to cause to enter a game or contest
{bc}to care for or train during the early stages of growth and development
{bc}to do or experience the first stages or actions of

dt.t: {wi}started{/wi} studying music at the age of five

pt: {sc}begin{/sc} {sc}commence{/sc} {sc}start{/sc} {sc}initiate{/sc} {sc}inaugurate{/sc} {sc}usher in{/sc} mean to take the first step in a course, process, or operation. {sc}begin{/sc}, {sc}start{/sc}, and {sc}commence{/sc} are often interchangeable. {sc}begin{/sc}, opposed to {it}end{/it}, is the most general.
{sc}start{/sc}, opposed to {it}stop{/it}, applies especially to first actions, steps, or stages.
{sc}commence{/sc} can be more formal or bookish than {sc}begin{/sc} or {sc}start{/sc}.
{sc}initiate{/sc} implies taking a first step in a process or series that is to continue.
{sc}inaugurate{/sc} suggests a beginning of some formality or notion of significance.

pt.t: the discovery of penicillin {it}inaugurated{/it} a new era in medicine

pt: {sc}usher in{/sc} is somewhat less weighty than {sc}inaugurate{/sc}.

pt.t: {it}ushered in{/it} a period of economic decline

et: Middle English {it}sterten{/it}; akin to Middle High German {it}sterzen{/it} to stand up stiffly, move quickly
shortdef: to move suddenly and violently : spring
to react with a sudden brief involuntary movement

dt: {bc}a device that usually consists of two blocks mounted on either side of an adjustable frame and that provides a runner with a rigid surface against which to brace the feet at the start of a race
{bc}one of a series of boxes or low platforms at one end of a pool on which a competitor stands for the start of a swimming race

shortdef: a device that usually consists of two blocks mounted on either side of an adjustable frame and that provides a runner with a rigid surface against which to brace the feet at the start of a race
one of a series of boxes or low platforms at one end of a pool on which a competitor stands for the start of a swimming race

dt: {bc}a mechanically operated barrier used as a starting device for a race
{bc}a barrier that when knocked aside by a competitor (such as a skier) starts an electronic timing device

shortdef: a mechanically operated barrier used as a starting device for a race
a barrier that when knocked aside by a competitor (such as a skier) starts an electronic timing device

dt: {bc}a special gun used to signal the beginning of a race

dt.t: The official fired the {it}starting gun{/it} and the runners were off.

dt: {bc}the signal made by a starting gun

dt.t: As soon as she heard the {it}starting gun{/it}, she took off running.

shortdef: a special gun used to signal the beginning of a race; also : the signal made by a starting gun

dt: {bc}a line that marks the beginning of a race

shortdef: a line that marks the beginning of a race

dt: {bc}the list of players who are playing when a game begins

dt.t: The manager has made some changes to the {it}starting lineup{/it}.

shortdef: the list of players who are playing when a game begins

dt: {bc}the pitcher who is playing at the beginning of the game

dt.t: The manager removed the {it}starting pitcher{/it} in the third inning.

shortdef: the pitcher who is playing at the beginning of the game

dt.t: The tire tracks at the scene of the crime were a {it}starting point{/it} for investigators.

dt: {bc}the basic price when nothing extra has been added

dt.t: The {it}starting price{/it} for the car is $18,000.

shortdef: the basic price when nothing extra has been added

dt: {bc}the salary people are paid when they start a job

shortdef: the salary people are paid when they start a job
